description: On March 15, it was announced that to fight incorrect information, Ukraine’s health ministry has partnered with Facebook, which has 14 million users in the country. The social network will push updates from verified sources such as the ministry website and the government coronavirus information website, covid19.com.ua.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 31, the Anti-Monopoly Committee of Ukraine bans advertisements of any medications as treatment for the coronavirus as such ads are deceptive. Pharmaceutical companies, advertising agencies and media companies that violate the law will be fined up to 5% of their annual revenues.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Due to the significant spread of COVID-19 in certain areas, all administrative-territorial units in Ukraine are classified as regions with a red level of epidemic danger. Among those are: Horodenkiv and Kosiv districts of Ivano-Frankivsk region, Sambir city of Lviv region, Bilyaivka city of Odessa region, Dubno city, Kostopil and Rivne districts of Rivne region, Kitsman district of Chernivtsi region. This decision was made by the Central Commission for Technogenic and Environmental Safety and Emergencies at a meeting on August 13. Restrictions will apply from August 17.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Starting from March 12, only 49 out of 219 border crossing checkpoints will operate in Ukraine
target_geog_level: All countries

description: As of April 7, Ukraine's state border will be allowed to cross only by motor vehicles and exceptionally through 19 checkpoints. This is envisaged by the amendments made to Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine No. 288-р “On the temporary closure of some border crossing points and border checkpoints and termination of pedestrian traffic in those checkpoints”.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Starting from March 12, only 49 out of 219 border crossing checkpoints will operate in Ukraine. However, starting March 17, Ukraine's state border will be allowed to cross only by motor vehicles and exceptionally through 19 checkpoints. UPDATE: The original entry did not restrict rail, air and other vehicles on the checkpoints and 49 checkpoints were available, however now Ukraine's state border will be allowed to cross only by motor vehicles and exceptionally through 19 checkpoints.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On April 15 the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine has supported the closure of another 10 crossing points for motor vehicles on border in order to increase the safety level to abide by quarantine restrictions. "It is proposed to close the following checkpoints "Kostely", "Smilnytsia", "Hrushiv", "Ugryniv", "Solotvyno", "Kalmintsi", "Bronnytsia", "Sokyryany", "Novi Trojany" and "Palanka". These are checkpoints for automobile and sometimes pedestrian traffic," the Minister added.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: As of April 7, Ukraine's state border will be allowed to cross only by motor vehicles and exceptionally through 19 checkpoints. However, on Apil 15 it was announced that Ukraine has supported the closure of another 10 crossing points for motor vehicles on the border UPDATE: The original policy allowed 19 checkpoints to operate, now another 10 are closing
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On May 6, the Ukrainian Government adopted a decision resuming the operation of checkpoints across the state border Rava-Ruska for motor communication and Skadovsk Sea Commercial Port for marine communication
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Ukrainian Government supported a proposal on the opening of Shehyni border checkpoint. The decision will take effect from the moment of its publication
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: In accordance with the requirements of the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine No. 477 of June 12, 2020, the operation of 15 checkpoints for air communication has been resumed. Airports allowed entry for foreigners who are not citizens of countries with a high COVID-19 morbidity rate and have not been on the territory of such states for the past 14 days.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
In Ukraine, the Cabinet of Ministers has ordered State Institution "Kyiv City Laboratory Center of the Ministry of Health of Ukraine", Department of Health of the executive body of the Kyiv City Council (KCSA), district state administrations in Kyiv, Main Directorate of the National Police of Ukraine in Kyiv to organize joint work on timely detection, examination and isolation of persons who have been in contact with patients in whom the case of COVID-19 has been laboratory confirmed
Responsible: Chumak SP, Ginzburg VG, heads of districts in the city, Kyiv state administrations, Kryshchenko AE
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
According to a resolution initiated by Ukraine's Minister of Health adopted at a government meeting on March 25, health facilities have the right to conduct a mandatory medical examination of people who have symptoms of COVID-19 or who have been in contact with people who are diagnosed with COVID-19 if these individuals refuse to be examined voluntarily. 
The Health Ministry will develop and approve the procedure for mandatory hospitalization of people who are diagnosed (or suspected) of COVID-19, and who evade treatment, examination and quarantine (self-isolation) on a voluntary basis, as well as the mandatory self-isolation of people who are diagnosed (or suspected) COVID-19 and their contact persons.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting on April 6, all Ukrainians who arrived in the country from abroad since March 17 and signed documents upon their arrival promising to self-isolate for 14 days will receive a link to install the Diy Vdoma app. Those infected who are being treated at home will also receive the link. The app monitors whether people are self-isolating and using it will be voluntary for now.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Funds have been directed to curbing the spread of COVID-19.

description: Since March 17 the Ukrainian government will give extra payments to employees of medical institutions and other individuals who work to stop the spread of the coronavirus. Their salary can up to double while the country is fighting the virus. Starting July 1, a new increase in salaries initiated by the Ministry of Health of Ukraine will amount to additional 50%. UPDATE: The original policy states that the salaries can up to double. The update states there will be an additional 50% raise in salaries.

In particular, UAH 1 billion will be transferred for the purchase of Antibody ELISA tests for SARS-CoV-2 to allow performing plus 1 million tests per month. Almost UAH 213 million will be transferred for the development of laboratory facilities in communal facilities, in order to increase PCR testing in hospitals.

description: According to the resolution of the Chief State Sanitary Doctor of Ukraine of April 27, 2020 No. 14 "On combating the spread of coronavirus disease COVID-19 in agricultural commodity markets", agro-food markets must abide by the requirements for anti-epidemic measures. Among other things, the list of requirements include disinfection of contact surfaces every three hours, cleaning and disinfection of all premises, including retail outlets at the end of each working day
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May 19, the Ministry of Health of Ukraine announced recommendations for public transport. Daily disinfection of vehicles should be carried out and antiseptics should be provided if possible. In addition, bus station premises must be disinfected at least once every 5 hours, as well as before opening and after closing.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From March 17 until April 3 transportation of passengers by subway is suspended in Kyiv, Kharkiv and Dnipro

description:
Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine on March 11, to properly organize the transportation of employees of Kyiv have decided: 
The Department of Transport Infrastructure of the executive body of the Kyiv City Council (Kyiv City State Administration) to ensure the production and issuance of enterprises, institutions, organizations that ensure the viability of the city of Kyiv, a special ticket for transportation of their employees in urban land transport (tram, trolleybus, bus)
Responsible: Osipov VO
From March 23, to the municipal enterprise "Kyivpastrans", which carries out transportation of passengers by land transport to provide transportation on separately defined routes only to those persons who have the appropriate special tickets, identity cards and means of individual protection according to the concluded agreements with the enterprises, establishments, the organizations providing vital activity of the city of Kyiv
Responsible: Osipov VO, Levchenko DV
From March 23, 2020, the Municipal Transport Service of the executive body of the Kyiv City Council (KCSA), if necessary, to involve carriers of any form of ownership that carry passengers by road, for transportation on specially defined routes only those persons holding appropriate special tickets, identity cards and personal protective equipment
Responsible: Osipov VO, Savtyr SV
Deadline: March 22, 2020
At least 1 law enforcement officer will be on each vehicle's board to ensure compliance
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
"The Ukrainian parliament has passed new laws aimed at mitigating the effects of novel coronavirus. 
Those who fail to follow the rules and are proven guilty will face up to three years in prison. If these actions cause death or other grave consequences, individuals can be sentenced to five-seven years in prison.
The law also introduces punishment for violation of quarantine, sanitary and hygienic rules and anti-epidemic measures. Those who violate the restrictions will face fines from Hr 17,000 ($630) to 51,000 ($1,890), six months of arrest, or up to three years in prison."
type_text: For violation of quarantine rules, a fine is envisaged. And if one violates sanitary rules and regulations for the prevention of infectious diseases, he/she may be brought to criminal responsibility.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The Foreign Ministry launched a program called “Zahyst” (“Protection”) to help Ukrainians trapped abroad. Ukraine’s embassies and consulates around the world will inform them about possible ways to return home and will help resolve visa issues. They will coordinate with local authorities, law enforcement, and businesses to help Ukrainians find places to stay and will help protect their rights.
type_text: Launching a special program to help Ukrainian citizens return home from abroad
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Dashboard contains information on the place of hospitalization and a level of institutions for hospitalization of patients with COVID-19. description: The Ukrainian government has supported new restrictions that oblige all those arriving in Ukraine from abroad to undergo a 14-day quarantine under thorough medical supervision, Deputy Health Minister of Ukraine Viktor Lyashko said during a March 30 online briefing. And following new restrictive measures put in place on March 29, all citizens coming to the country this way will be placed in quarantine for 14 days. They will have to stay on the premises chosen by state oblast administrations, including in regional hotels and sanatoria.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: In Ukraine, starting March 17 until April 3, all cultural, shopping, and entertainment centers, restaurants, cafés, and fitness centers will close. Restaurants and cafés can continue to cook food, which can be ordered from home. All public authorities, healthcare facilities, and law enforcement agencies will operate as normal. Grocery stores, gas stations, pharmacies, banking institutions, and insurance companies will also continue to provide service nationwide.

description: In Ukraine, starting March 17 until April 3, all cultural, shopping, and entertainment centers, restaurants, cafés, and fitness centers will close. Restaurants and cafés can continue to cook food, which can be ordered from home. All public authorities, healthcare facilities, and law enforcement agencies will operate as normal. Grocery stores, gas stations, pharmacies, banking institutions, and insurance companies will also continue to provide service nationwide. UPDATE: The original policy was set to last until April 3, it has been extended to April 24.

description: In Ukraine, from March 12 till April 3, access to the administrative buildings and offices of the Verkhovna Rada will be limited for everyone except deputies, employees of the Office of the Verkhovna Rada, assistant-consultants of deputies of Ukraine, who work under a fixed-term contract on a permanent basis. As a result, personal reception of citizens in the administrative buildings of the Verkhovna Rada was also suspended till April 3.
